────────────────────────────────
**Summary**
• House Republicans are attempting to cancel the Plankton, Aerosol, Cloud, ocean Ecosystem (PACE) and Climate Absolute Radiance and Refractivity Observatory (CLARREO) Pathfinder missions.
• PACE is designed to study ocean health and aerosols, while CLARREO Pathfinder would improve climate models by measuring reflected sunlight.
• The justification for the cancellations is based on budgetary concerns and a questioning of the value of climate research.
• Scrapping the satellites would save money in the short term but would eliminate valuable climate data.
• The move is part of a long-standing effort by some Republicans to reduce funding for climate science.

**Why it matters**
• Canceling these missions would hinder scientists' ability to monitor and understand climate change, affecting long-term climate projections.
• Investors in renewable energy and sustainable technologies rely on accurate climate data, which could be compromised.

**Risks**
• The absence of data from PACE and CLARREO Pathfinder could lead to less informed policy decisions regarding climate change mitigation and adaptation.

**Opportunities**
• Continued operation of the satellites could provide more precise climate data, potentially opening new avenues for technological innovation in climate solutions.

**Market view**
Market — Climate research and data accuracy are crucial for guiding investments and policy in sectors affected by climate change.
